1.text: But speak thou the things which befit the sound doctrine:

2.text: that aged men be temperate, grave, soberminded, sound in faith, in love, in patience:

3.text: that aged women likewise be reverent in demeanour, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is good;

4.text: that they may train the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,

5.text: to be soberminded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed:

6.text: the younger men likewise exhort to be soberminded:

7.text: in all things shewing thyself an ensample of good works; in thy doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity,

8.text: sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of us.

9.text: Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters, and to be well-pleasing to them in all things; not gainsaying;

10.text: not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

11.text: For the grace of God hath appeared, bringing salvation to all men,

12.text: instructing us, to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly and righteously and godly in this present world;

13.text: looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ;

14.text: who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a people for his own possession, zealous of good works.

15.text: These things speak and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise thee.
